alert.note: Alert for Imperial; Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 6:23PM PDT until August 24 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN IMPERIAL AND RIVERSIDE COUNTIES... At 623 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain along I-10 east of Desert Center. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blythe. This includes the following highways... CA Route 78 between mile markers 56 and 65. CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 115 and 124. This includes the following streams and drainages... Seco, Arroyo, Milpitas Wash, Colorado River and Vinagre Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
